'Listing goal': 'Lists IP ranges belonging to officially published abuse addresses that either bounce or request not to receive abuse notices. The aim of this list is to block companies that openly shrug their abuse responsibilities.'
'Nomination': 'Abuse addresses that fail to be deliverable for 3 our of the last 7 days are automatically added.'
'Listing lifetime': 'Lifetime listing or automatic once mail delivery resumes in the case of automated additions.'

'Listing goal': 'Lists IP ranges belonging to abuse addresses that have failed to handle abuse issues for at least 30 days. The aim of this list is to hold companies accountable for the abuse that originates from their networks rather than just ignoring it.'
'Nomination': 'Issues are tracked per IP for the same issue'
'Listing lifetime': 'Automatic removal is done once all hosts with abuse unresolved for 30 days have been clean for 2 weeks.'
'Notes': 'Data for lists are generated from live data collected by the WebIron web security platform.'

'Listing goal': 'Lists single IP addresses recently attacking websites and servers.'
'Nomination': 'Lists IP addressed belonging to hosts that have attacked at least twice within the last 48 hours.'
'Listing lifetime': 'Automatic removal is done once a host has gone 24 hours without an incident'
'Notes': 'Data for lists are generated from live data collected by the WebIron web security platform.'

'Listing goal': 'Contains IP addresses and ranges from BABL
'Notes': 'Depends on list'

'Listing goal': 'Web Crawler IP lookup used to match user agents with known crawler IP addresses. Data from this list is considered BETA.'
'Notes': 'This DNSRBL contains valid and legitimate crawlers. Matching alone should not be used for blocking'

'Listing goal': 'truncate.gbudb.net'
'Nomination': 'Extremely conservative list of single IP4 addresses that produce exclusively spam/malware as indicated by the GBUdb IP Reputation system. Most systems should be able to safely reject connections based on this list.'
'Listing lifetime': 'Automatic: IPs are added when the GBUdb "cloud" statistics reach a probability figure that indicates 95% of messages produce a spam/malware pattern match and a confidence figure that indicates sufficient data to trust the probability data.'
'Notes': 'Automatic: Continuous while reputation statistics remain bad. Warning: Produces false positives
'Collateral listings': and has no remedy/removal process. IPs are dropped quickly if the statistics improve (within an hour). IPs are dropped within 36 hours (typ) if no more messages are seen (dead zombie).'
'Notifies upon listing': 'Source data is derived from a global network of Message Sniffer[1] filtering nodes in real-time. Truncate data is updated from statistics every 10 minutes.'

'Listing goal': 'Single IP addresses which only send UBE. Specializing in snowshoe spam and other 'under the radar' spams which evade many other DNSBLs. Has FP-level comparable to Zen.'
'Nomination': 'Automatic (upon receipt of a spam to a real person's mailbox)
'Listing lifetime': with extensive whitelists and filtering to prevent false positives'
'Notes': 'Typically an automatic expiration 11 days after the last abuse was seen
'Notifies upon listing': 'Spam samples are always kept on file for each listing. Removal requests are manually reviewed and processed without fees.'

'Listing goal': 'Lists /24 blocks of IP addresses which usually only send UBE and containing at least several addresses which are confirmed emitters of junk mail. Collateral listings are kept to a minimum because subsections are often carved from /24 listings when spammers and legit senders share the same /24 block.'
'Nomination': 'Automatic once at least several IP addresses from a given block are individually listed on ivmSIP
'Listing lifetime': with extensive whitelists and filtering to prevent false positives'
'Notes': 'Expiration time increases to many weeks as the fraction of IP addresses in the /24 block in question sending junk mail increases'
'Collateral listings': 'Removal requests are quickly and manually reviewed and processed without fees.'

'Listing goal': 'Comparable to uribl.com and surbl.org
'Nomination': this is a list of IP addresses and domains which are used by spammers in the clickable links found in the body of spam messages'
'Listing lifetime': 'Automatic (upon receipt of a spam to a real person's mailbox)
'Notes': with extensive whitelists and filtering to prevent false positives'
'Collateral listings': 'Typically an automatic expiration several weeks after the last abuse was seen.'
'Notifies upon listing': 'Spam samples are always kept on file for each listing. Removal requests are quickly and manually reviewed and processed without fees.'

'Listing goal': 'Lists all types of open (publicly accessible) proxies'
